trans-unit.source: Move data to and from SQL Server | Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from SQL Server | Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Learn about how to move data to/from SQL Server database that is on-premises or in an Azure VM using Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Learn about how to move data to/from SQL Server database that is on-premises or in an Azure VM using Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to SQL Server from another data store and move data from another data store to SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to SQL Server from another data store and move data from another data store to SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.

trans-unit.source: The concepts and steps needed for connecting with SQL Server hosted on-premises or in Azure IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service) VMs are the same.
trans-unit.target: The concepts and steps needed for connecting with SQL Server hosted on-premises or in Azure IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service) VMs are the same.

trans-unit.source: In both cases, you need to leverage Data Management Gateway for connectivity.
trans-unit.target: In both cases, you need to leverage Data Management Gateway for connectivity.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title> article to learn about Data Management Gateway and step-by-step instructions on setting up the gateway.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title> article to learn about Data Management Gateway and step-by-step instructions on setting up the gateway.

trans-unit.source: Setting up a gateway instance is a pre-requisite for connecting with SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Setting up a gateway instance is a pre-requisite for connecting with SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: While you can install the gateway on the same on-premises machine or cloud VM instance as the SQL Server for better performance it is recommended to install them on separate machines or cloud VM to avoid resource contention.
trans-unit.target: While you can install the gateway on the same on-premises machine or cloud VM instance as the SQL Server for better performance it is recommended to install them on separate machines or cloud VM to avoid resource contention.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in SQL Server database to a blob every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in SQL Server database to a blob every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: As a first step, please setup the data management gateway as per the instructions in the <linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title> article.
trans-unit.target: As a first step, please setup the data management gateway as per the instructions in the <linkText>moving data between on-premises locations and cloud</linkText><title></title> article.

trans-unit.source: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in SQL Server and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.
trans-unit.target: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in SQL Server and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.

trans-unit.source: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy information the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy information the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title> with Copy activity that uses <linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in SQL Server database every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in SQL Server database every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.

trans-unit.source: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: You should create the table in SQL Server with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.
trans-unit.target: You should create the table in SQL Server with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.

trans-unit.source: New rows are added to the table every hour.
trans-unit.target: New rows are added to the table every hour.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to SQL Server linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to SQL Server linked service.

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to: OnPremisesSqlServer.
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to: OnPremisesSqlServer.

trans-unit.source: Specify connectionString information needed to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database using either SQL authentication or Windows authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify connectionString information needed to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database using either SQL authentication or Windows authentication.

trans-unit.source: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Specify user name if you are using Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify user name if you are using Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.
trans-unit.target: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.

trans-unit.source: You can encrypt credentials using the New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet and use them in the connection string as shown in the following example (EncryptedCredential property):
trans-unit.target: You can encrypt credentials using the New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet and use them in the connection string as shown in the following example (EncryptedCredential property):

trans-unit.source: If username and password are specified, gateway will use them to impersonate the specified user account to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: If username and password are specified, gateway will use them to impersonate the specified user account to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, gateway will connect to the SQL Server directly with the security context of Gateway (its startup account).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, gateway will connect to the SQL Server directly with the security context of Gateway (its startup account).

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Setting Credentials and Security</linkText><title></title> for details about setting credentials for an SQL Server data source.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Setting Credentials and Security</linkText><title></title> for details about setting credentials for an SQL Server data source.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (SQL Server, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the <linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (SQL Server, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section for the dataset of type SqlServerTable has the following properties.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section for the dataset of type SqlServerTable has the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the SQL Server Database instance that linked service refers to.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the SQL Server Database instance that linked service refers to.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the <linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.

trans-unit.source: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.
trans-unit.target: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.

trans-unit.source: In case of Copy activity when source is of type SqlSource the following properties are available in typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: In case of Copy activity when source is of type SqlSource the following properties are available in typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Use the custom query to read data.
trans-unit.target: Use the custom query to read data.

trans-unit.source: SQL query string.For example: select * from MyTable.
trans-unit.target: SQL query string.For example: select * from MyTable.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the SQL statement that is executed: select from MyTable.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the SQL statement that is executed: select from MyTable.

trans-unit.source: User specified stored procedure name to upsert (update/insert) data into the target table.
trans-unit.target: User specified stored procedure name to upsert (update/insert) data into the target table.

trans-unit.source: User specified table type name to be used in the above stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: User specified table type name to be used in the above stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Copy activity makes the data being moved available in a temp table with this table type.
trans-unit.target: Copy activity makes the data being moved available in a temp table with this table type.

trans-unit.source: Stored procedure code can then merge the data being copied with existing data.
trans-unit.target: Stored procedure code can then merge the data being copied with existing data.

trans-unit.source: Inserts data into the SQL table when the buffer size reaches writeBatchSize
trans-unit.target: Inserts data into the SQL table when the buffer size reaches writeBatchSize

trans-unit.source: Wait time for the batch insert operation to complete before it times out.
trans-unit.target: Wait time for the batch insert operation to complete before it times out.

trans-unit.source: User specified query for Copy Activity to execute to make sure that data of a specific slice will be cleaned up.
trans-unit.target: User specified query for Copy Activity to execute to make sure that data of a specific slice will be cleaned up.

trans-unit.source: User specified column name for Copy Activity to fill with auto generated slice identifier, which will be used to clean up data of a specific slice when rerun.
trans-unit.target: User specified column name for Copy Activity to fill with auto generated slice identifier, which will be used to clean up data of a specific slice when rerun.

trans-unit.source: Column name of a column with data type of binary(32).
trans-unit.target: Column name of a column with data type of binary(32).

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article, the Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the <linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title> article, the Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:

trans-unit.source: Convert from native source types to .NET type
trans-unit.target: Convert from native source types to .NET type

trans-unit.source: Convert from .NET type to native sink type
trans-unit.target: Convert from .NET type to native sink type

trans-unit.source: When moving data to & from Azure SQL, SQL server, Sybase the following mappings will be used from SQL type to .NET type and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: When moving data to & from Azure SQL, SQL server, Sybase the following mappings will be used from SQL type to .NET type and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: The mapping is same as the SQL Server Data Type Mapping for ADO.NET.
trans-unit.target: The mapping is same as the SQL Server Data Type Mapping for ADO.NET.
